Risk analysis:

- Moving DOWN centralizes us and gives more escape routes than LEFT/RIGHT along the top edge. That helps us avoid getting boxed in later and allows aggressive routing toward contested apples next few turns.

Short-term move rationale (fans, listen close): go DOWN to get off the top edge, increase maneuverability, and start angling toward the (1,8) apple while keeping ability to pivot toward the opponent if they creep up. We want to be the one cutting off lanes, not getting cut off.

Long-term plan (for next turns / to show back as last rationale):
- Keep centralized and avoid edges until we can safely corral the opponent.
- Prioritize apples near the opponent to pressure them, but only engage head-on if we have a clear score advantage.
- Use our superior mobility from central positions to force the opponent into tight spaces and bait them into collisions or contested apples we can snatch.
